result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
1:48 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Joel T Pomeroy in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Joel T Pomeroy. 

Preliminary Hearing requested. Preliminary time limits waived. 
Attorney Bucher requests to address bail.
The State objects as victims need to be notified.
The Court will not address bail and requires attorney Bucher to file a bail motion. 
Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing December 1, 2022.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
1:21 PM Defendant Joel T Pomeroy in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing December 1, 2022. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Notice Regarding United States Passport For Criminal Defendant

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  If defendant has a passport, defendant to surrender their passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 48 hours of release from custody.  Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance, duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action.

3:25 PM Defendant Joel T Pomeroy in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Joel T Pomeroy.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court provides the defendant with the Petition for Court appointed counsel and sets matter for a status of counsel date next week.
Hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
